ModemManager.service.description: DBus-activated daemon that controls mobile broadband (2G/3G/4G) interfaces and USB dongles
ModemManager.service.notes: Manages cellular modems and mobile broadband devices. Can be disabled if no mobile broadband hardware is present.

NetworkManager-wait-online.service.description: Delays reaching the network-online target until NetworkManager reports startup complete
NetworkManager-wait-online.service.notes: Ensures network connectivity before starting network-dependent services. Part of systemd network targets.

NetworkManager.service.description: Network connection manager for Ethernet, WiFi, mobile broadband, and VPN connections
NetworkManager.service.notes: Primary network management daemon on most Linux distributions. Handles automatic network configuration.

UNIT.description: NGINX Unit - dynamic web and application server
UNIT.notes: Polyglot app server that can run applications in multiple languages (Python, PHP, Go, JavaScript, etc.)

accounts-daemon.service.description: Provides user account management for desktop environments and system tools
accounts-daemon.service.notes: Manages user account information, avatars, and settings. Used by desktop environments and login managers.

acpid.service.description: Advanced Configuration and Power Interface event daemon for power management
acpid.service.notes: Handles ACPI events like power button presses, lid close/open, battery events. Essential for laptop power management.

alsa-restore.service.description: Save and restore ALSA sound card mixer settings
alsa-restore.service.notes: Preserves audio mixer settings between reboots. Part of ALSA (Advanced Linux Sound Architecture).

apache-htcacheclean.description: Apache HTTP Server disk cache maintenance utility
apache-htcacheclean.notes: Keeps Apache disk cache within size limits

apache2.access: HTTP on port 80, HTTPS on port 443

apparmor.service.description: Linux Security Module providing mandatory access control and application security profiles
apparmor.service.notes: Confines applications to a limited set of resources. Loads security profiles at boot time.

apport.service.description: Automatic crash report generation service for Ubuntu systems
apport.service.notes: Collects crash dumps and system information for debugging. Ubuntu/Debian specific.

auditd.service.description: Security auditing framework for tracking system calls and file access
auditd.service.notes: Records security-relevant information for compliance and forensics. Required for SELinux.

autofs.service.description: Automatically mounts and unmounts filesystems on demand
autofs.service.notes: Useful for NFS shares, removable media. Mounts only when accessed, unmounts when idle.

avahi-daemon.service.description: Multicast DNS service discovery daemon for zero-configuration networking
avahi-daemon.service.notes: Enables .local domain resolution and service discovery. Used for printer discovery, SSH, etc.

availability_log.service.description: Custom service for logging system availability and uptime metrics
availability_log.service.notes: Site-specific monitoring service. Configuration depends on local implementation.

big3d.description: F5 BIG-IP agent that answers 3DNS Controller queries and collects network path performance data
big3d.notes: Part of F5's Global Server Load Balancing (GSLB) system. Calculates network performance data and returns it to 3DNS Controllers for dynamic load balancing decisions.

blk-availability.service.description: Ensures block devices are available before dependent services start
blk-availability.service.notes: Part of LVM2. Activates volume groups and logical volumes at boot time.

bluetooth.service.description: Bluetooth protocol stack for wireless communication with peripherals
bluetooth.service.notes: Manages Bluetooth adapters, pairing, and connected devices. Can be disabled if no Bluetooth hardware.

casaos.description: Open-source personal cloud operating system for home servers
casaos.notes: Docker-based home server OS with app marketplace. Provides unified interface for self-hosted services.

casaos-app-management.service.description: CasaOS service for managing Docker-based applications and containers
casaos-app-management.service.notes: Handles installation, updates, and management of CasaOS apps through Docker containers.

casaos-gateway.service.description: API gateway and routing service for CasaOS microservices architecture
casaos-gateway.service.notes: Routes requests between CasaOS frontend and backend services. Core component of CasaOS.

casaos-local-st.notes: Manages local storage, file operations, and disk management for CasaOS.

casaos-local-storage.service.description: CasaOS storage management service for local disks and file systems
casaos-local-storage.service.notes: Provides storage abstraction and management for CasaOS applications and user data.

casaos-message-bus.service.description: Inter-service communication bus for CasaOS microservices
casaos-message-bus.service.notes: Handles communication between different CasaOS services and components.

casaos-user-ser.description: CasaOS user management and authentication service
casaos-user-ser.notes: Manages user accounts, authentication, and access control for CasaOS.

casaos-user-service.service.description: User management and authentication service for CasaOS
casaos-user-service.service.notes: Handles user registration, login, permissions, and session management.

casaos.service.description: Main daemon for CasaOS personal cloud operating system
casaos.service.notes: Core CasaOS service that coordinates all other components and provides the main interface.

chmand.service.description: Custom hardware monitoring and management service
chmand.service.notes: Site-specific hardware monitoring service. Configuration depends on local implementation.

cloud-config.service.description: Cloud-init service for applying cloud configuration during early boot
cloud-config.service.notes: Configures instances in cloud environments. Handles SSH keys, packages, user data.

cloud-final.service.access: User data scripts and package management
cloud-final.service.description: Final stage of cloud-init that runs user scripts and package installations
cloud-final.service.notes: Last stage of cloud-init. Runs once per instance, handles user scripts and final setup.

cloud-init-local.service.description: Early cloud-init stage for local configuration before networking
cloud-init-local.service.notes: First stage of cloud-init. Runs before networking, handles local data sources.

cloud-init.service.description: Cloud instance initialization service for automated system setup
cloud-init.service.notes: Industry standard for cloud instance initialization. Configures networking, users, packages.

cluster.service.description: Custom clustering service for distributed systems management
cluster.service.notes: Site-specific clustering implementation. Configuration depends on cluster software used.

colord.service.description: System service for color profile management and display calibration
colord.service.notes: Manages ICC color profiles for displays, printers, and scanners. Used by GNOME and KDE.

console-getty.service.description: Getty service for console login on serial or virtual consoles
console-getty.service.notes: Provides login service on system console. Part of util-linux package.

console-setup.service.description: Configures console font and keyboard layout for virtual terminals
console-setup.service.notes: Sets up console appearance and keyboard layout. Debian/Ubuntu specific service.

container-getty@1.service.description: Getty login service for container console 1
container-getty@1.service.notes: Provides login access to container console. Part of systemd container support.

container-getty@2.service.description: Getty login service for container console 2
container-getty@2.service.notes: Provides login access to container console. Part of systemd container support.

containerd.access: gRPC API on Unix socket and port 44191
containerd.notes: Container runtime used by Kubernetes and Docker

corosync.service.description: Group communication system providing closed process groups for cluster software
corosync.service.notes: Cluster membership and messaging layer. Used by Pacemaker for high availability clusters.

cron.service.description: Time-based job scheduler daemon for running periodic tasks
cron.service.notes: Executes scheduled commands and scripts. Essential for automated maintenance tasks.

crond.service.description: Alternative name for cron daemon in some distributions
crond.service.notes: Same as cron.service. Used in RHEL/CentOS systems.

cups-browsed.service.description: Discovers network printers and makes them available to CUPS
cups-browsed.service.notes: Automatically discovers and configures network printers. Part of cups-filters package.

cups.service.description: Common UNIX Printing System daemon for managing print jobs and printers
cups.service.notes: Print server that handles printing to local and network printers.

cupsd.notes: Same as cups.service - the actual cupsd daemon process.

dbus.service.description: Inter-process communication system for desktop applications and system services
dbus.service.notes: Essential IPC mechanism. Required by most desktop environments and many system services.

devmgmtd.notes: Site-specific device management implementation. Configuration depends on local setup.

devmgmtd.service.description: Device management service for hardware monitoring and control
devmgmtd.service.notes: Custom implementation for device management. Likely site-specific service.

devmon@devmon.service.description: User service for monitoring removable device events
devmon@devmon.service.notes: Part of udevil package. Monitors device insertion/removal for auto-mounting.

dhclient.service.description: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol client for automatic IP configuration
dhclient.service.notes: Obtains IP address and network configuration from DHCP servers.

dhclient6.service.description: DHCP client for IPv6 address and configuration assignment
dhclient6.service.notes: IPv6 version of DHCP client for automatic IPv6 configuration.

dm-event.service.description: Monitors device-mapper events for LVM logical volumes and RAID arrays
dm-event.service.notes: Part of LVM2. Monitors volume groups and triggers actions on events like disk failures.

docker.access: Docker daemon socket or TCP port 2376
docker.notes: Container platform for building and running applications

dphys-swapfile.service.description: Manages swap file creation and sizing on Raspberry Pi and similar systems
dphys-swapfile.service.notes: Raspberry Pi specific. Creates and manages swap files dynamically based on available space.

etcd.description: Distributed key-value store for Kubernetes cluster data
etcd.notes: Critical Kubernetes component - stores all cluster data

evrouted.description: Custom event routing service for system events
evrouted.notes: Site-specific event routing implementation. Configuration depends on local setup.

f5-bootev.service.description: F5 Networks boot event processing service
f5-bootev.service.notes: Part of F5 BIG-IP system. Handles boot-time event processing.

f5-firewall.service.notes: Part of F5 BIG-IP system. Manages firewall rules and policies.

f5-label.service.description: F5 Networks system labeling and identification service
f5-label.service.notes: Part of F5 BIG-IP system. Manages system labels and identification.

f5-module-sysinit.service.description: F5 Networks system module initialization service
f5-module-sysinit.service.notes: Part of F5 BIG-IP system. Initializes system modules and services.

f5-rest-node.description: F5 Networks REST API service node
f5-rest-node.notes: Part of F5 BIG-IP system. Provides REST API interface for management.

fake-hwclock.service.description: Maintains system time on systems without a real-time clock
fake-hwclock.service.notes: Common on Raspberry Pi. Saves/restores time across reboots when no RTC is available.

finalrd.service.description: Final stage service for RAM disk cleanup and transition
finalrd.service.notes: Handles final cleanup of initial RAM disk during boot process.

fwupd.service.description: Service for updating device firmware automatically
fwupd.service.notes: Updates UEFI, device firmware. Integrates with LVFS (Linux Vendor Firmware Service).

getty@tty1.service.notes: Provides login prompt on first virtual terminal. Essential for console access.

grafana.notes: Visualization platform for metrics and logs

gtmd.access: iQuery protocol communication with big3d agents
gtmd.description: F5 BIG-IP DNS daemon that manages global server load balancing and intelligent DNS responses
gtmd.notes: Core component of F5's BIG-IP DNS (formerly 3DNS/GTM). Monitors BIG-IP system availability and network path integrity, makes intelligent DNS routing decisions based on performance data from big3d agents.

hddtemp.service.description: Monitors hard drive temperatures via SMART data
hddtemp.service.notes: Monitors disk temperatures and can provide data via network interface.

httpd.access: HTTP on port 80, HTTPS on port 443
httpd.notes: Same as apache2 service. RHEL/CentOS/Fedora naming convention.

icrd_child.description: Child process of F5 BIG-IP iControl REST API daemon
icrd_child.display_name: F5 iControl REST Daemon Child Process
icrd_child.notes: Child process of icrd (iControl REST Daemon). Handles F5 BIG-IP REST API requests for device management and configuration.

ifup@eth0.service.description: Brings up network interface eth0 using ifupdown
ifup@eth0.service.notes: Part of ifupdown package. Configures eth0 based on /etc/network/interfaces.

ifupdown-pre.service.description: Pre-configuration service for ifupdown network interfaces
ifupdown-pre.service.notes: Runs before network interfaces are configured. Part of ifupdown package.

ifupdown2-pre.service.description: Pre-configuration service for ifupdown2 network manager
ifupdown2-pre.service.notes: Enhanced version of ifupdown. Provides better network configuration management.

ipvsadm.service.description: IP Virtual Server administration and load balancing service
ipvsadm.service.notes: Manages Linux Virtual Server (LVS) load balancing rules and virtual services.

irqbalance.service.notes: AUTO-GENERATED: This service was automatically discovered. Please update with actual service information.

iscsid.service.description: Internet Small Computer Systems Interface initiator daemon
iscsid.service.notes: Manages connections to iSCSI storage targets over network.

java.notes: Generic Java process. Specific functionality depends on the application being run.

keyboard-setup.service.description: Configures keyboard layout for console and X11
keyboard-setup.service.notes: Sets system-wide keyboard layout and options. Debian/Ubuntu specific.

keymgmtd.description: Custom key management service for cryptographic operations
keymgmtd.notes: Site-specific key management implementation. Configuration depends on local setup.

kmod-static-nodes.service.description: Creates static device nodes required by kernel modules
kmod-static-nodes.service.notes: Creates /dev nodes for modules that need them before udev runs.

ksmtuned.service.description: Tunes KSM (Kernel Samepage Merging) for memory deduplication
ksmtuned.service.notes: Optimizes memory usage by merging identical memory pages. Useful for virtualization.

kube-apiserver.description: Kubernetes API server that serves the Kubernetes API
kube-apiserver.notes: Frontend for the Kubernetes control plane. Exposes the Kubernetes API.

kube-controller.description: Kubernetes controller manager that runs core control loops
kube-controller.notes: Manages replication, endpoints, service accounts, and tokens

kube-proxy.description: Kubernetes network proxy that maintains network rules on nodes
kube-proxy.notes: Handles service discovery and load balancing

kube-rbac-proxy.description: Proxy that enforces RBAC policies for Kubernetes metrics endpoints
kube-rbac-proxy.notes: Secures metrics endpoints by enforcing Kubernetes RBAC policies.

kube-scheduler.description: Kubernetes scheduler that assigns pods to nodes
kube-scheduler.notes: Watches for unscheduled pods and binds them to nodes

kubelet.access: API on port 10250, health check on 10248
kubelet.description: Kubernetes node agent that manages pods and containers

lm-sensors.service.description: Hardware monitoring service for temperature, voltage, and fan sensors
lm-sensors.service.notes: Provides hardware sensor data to applications like psensor, conky, etc.

lvm2-monitor.service.description: Monitors LVM2 logical volumes for metadata changes and failures
lvm2-monitor.service.notes: Part of LVM2. Monitors volume groups and logical volumes for changes.

lxc-monitord.service.description: Monitors LXC containers and manages container events
lxc-monitord.service.notes: Monitors container lifecycle events and provides container management.

lxc-net.service.description: Manages network bridge for LXC containers
lxc-net.service.notes: Creates and manages lxcbr0 bridge for container networking.

lxc.service.notes: Manages LXC system containers and provides container runtime.

lxcfs.service.description: FUSE filesystem for LXC containers to provide virtualized /proc and /sys
lxcfs.service.notes: Provides containerized view of system information for LXC containers.

mariadb.service.description: Open-source relational database management system, MySQL-compatible fork
mariadb.service.notes: Drop-in replacement for MySQL. Provides SQL database services with enhanced performance and features.

mariadbd.description: MariaDB database server daemon process (mysqld equivalent)
mariadbd.notes: The actual MariaDB server daemon process. Handles database connections, queries, and storage operations.

master.notes: AUTO-GENERATED: This service was automatically discovered. Please update with actual service information.

mcpd.description: F5 BIG-IP master control process daemon
mcpd.notes: Core F5 BIG-IP process that manages system resources and services.

miniserv.pl.description: Webmin's built-in web server for system administration interface
miniserv.pl.notes: Webmin's Perl-based web server for system administration via browser.

mosquitto.access: MQTT on port 1883, MQTT over TLS on 8883
mosquitto.description: Lightweight MQTT message broker for IoT and messaging applications
mosquitto.notes: Popular open-source MQTT broker for Internet of Things applications.

mosquitto.service.access: MQTT on port 1883, MQTT over TLS on 8883
mosquitto.service.description: MQTT message broker service for IoT device communication
mosquitto.service.notes: Same as mosquitto - the systemd service version.

multipathd.service.description: Device mapper multipath daemon for managing redundant storage paths
multipathd.service.notes: Manages multiple I/O paths to storage devices for redundancy and performance.

named.description: Berkeley Internet Name Domain (BIND) DNS server daemon
named.notes: Authoritative DNS server and recursive resolver. Part of BIND package.

named.service.description: BIND DNS server service for domain name resolution
named.service.notes: Same as named - the systemd service version.

networkd-dispatcher.service.notes: Runs scripts when network interfaces change state. Similar to NetworkManager dispatcher.

networking.service.notes: Configures network interfaces from /etc/network/interfaces. Alternative to NetworkManager.

nfs-kernel-server.service.description: Network File System kernel server for sharing filesystems
nfs-kernel-server.service.notes: Exports filesystems via NFS protocol for network file sharing.

nftables.service.description: Modern Linux firewall using nftables framework
nftables.service.notes: Successor to iptables. Provides packet filtering, NAT, and traffic shaping.

nginx.access: HTTP on port 80, HTTPS on port 443
nginx.description: High-performance web server and reverse proxy
nginx.notes: Web server, reverse proxy, and load balancer

nmbd.service.description: the systemd service that starts and stops the nmbd daemon, which is the NetBIOS name server and browsing daemon within the Samba suite.

node_exporter.description: Prometheus exporter for hardware and OS metrics
node_exporter.notes: Exposes system metrics for Prometheus monitoring

ntp.service.description: Time synchronization daemon using NTP protocol
ntp.service.notes: Synchronizes system clock with network time servers. Alternative to systemd-timesyncd.

perl.notes: AUTO-GENERATED: This service was automatically discovered. Please update with actual service information.

pihole-FTL.access: DNS on port 53, Web admin on port 80/443
pihole-FTL.description: Pi-hole's Faster Than Light (FTL) DNS server with ad-blocking
pihole-FTL.notes: Network-wide ad blocker that acts as DNS sinkhole. Includes web interface.

pihole-FTL.service.access: DNS on port 53, Web admin interface
pihole-FTL.service.description: Pi-hole DNS ad-blocking service with web interface
pihole-FTL.service.notes: Same as pihole-FTL - the systemd service version.

plymouth-quit-wait.service.description: Waits for Plymouth boot splash to finish before continuing
plymouth-quit-wait.service.notes: Coordinates boot splash screen with other system services.

plymouth-quit.service.notes: Terminates boot splash screen when boot process completes.

plymouth-read-write.service.description: Tells Plymouth to write out runtime data
plymouth-read-write.service.notes: Saves Plymouth runtime data for next boot cycle.

polkit.service.description: Authorization framework for privileged operations in user sessions
polkit.service.notes: Allows unprivileged processes to communicate with privileged ones securely.

postfix.service.description: Mail transfer agent (MTA) for routing and delivering email
postfix.service.notes: Popular secure mail server alternative to sendmail.

postfix@-.service.notes: Instance-based Postfix service for multiple configurations.

prometheus.notes: Time series database and monitoring system

racoon.description: Internet Key Exchange (IKE) daemon for IPsec VPNs
racoon.notes: IPsec key management daemon. Part of ipsec-tools package.

redis.description: In-memory data structure store and cache
redis.notes: In-memory database used for caching and message brokering

rpc-statd-notify.service.description: Notifies NFS peers of a restart for lock recovery
rpc-statd-notify.service.notes: Part of NFS. Notifies remote systems after reboot for lock recovery.

rpc.statd.description: Network Status Monitor (NSM) daemon for NFS file locking
rpc.statd.notes: Monitors NFS clients and servers for crash recovery. Essential for NFS locking.

rpcbind.description: RPC portmapper service for mapping RPC program numbers to ports
rpcbind.notes: Required for NFS and other RPC-based services. Maps RPC services to network ports.

rpi-eeprom-update.service.description: Updates Raspberry Pi bootloader and USB firmware
rpi-eeprom-update.service.notes: Raspberry Pi specific. Updates bootloader EEPROM when new versions available.

rsyslog.service.access: Syslog on port 514, log files in /var/log/
rsyslog.service.description: Advanced system logging daemon with filtering and forwarding capabilities
rsyslog.service.notes: Enhanced syslog daemon with advanced filtering, forwarding, and database support.

serial-getty@ttyAMA10.service.description: Getty login service for serial console ttyAMA10
serial-getty@ttyAMA10.service.notes: Provides login service on ARM serial console. Common on embedded systems.

smbd.description: SMB/CIFS file sharing daemon for Windows interoperability
smbd.notes: Provides file and printer sharing with Windows systems.

snmpd.description: Simple Network Management Protocol agent for network monitoring
snmpd.notes: Provides system information via SNMP for network monitoring systems.

sod.access: Command line interface and hardware failover cables
sod.description: F5 BIG-IP daemon that controls failover functions and high availability operations
sod.notes: Controls BIG-IP Controller fail-over functions. Manages high availability between paired BIG-IP systems using serial ports or network connections. Critical for HA operations.

speaker.notes: Bare metal load balancer for Kubernetes

ssh.description: Secure shell server for remote access
ssh.notes: Secure remote access and file transfer

sshd.description: Secure shell server for remote access
sshd.notes: Secure remote access and file transfer

stats.pl.description: Custom Perl script for system statistics collection
stats.pl.notes: Site-specific statistics script. Configuration depends on local implementation.

sysstat.service.description: System performance monitoring and statistics collection service
sysstat.service.notes: Collects system performance data. Includes sar, iostat, mpstat tools.

systemd.description: System and service manager (PID 1) for Linux systems
systemd.notes: Init system and service manager. Controls all other services on the system.

systemd-resolve.description: Network name resolution service with DNS caching
systemd-resolve.notes: Provides DNS resolution and caching. Alternative to traditional resolv.conf.

systemd-resolved.notes: Provides DNS resolution for the system

tmrouted.notes: Site-specific traffic management implementation. Configuration depends on local setup.

tvheadend.notes: Digital TV backend with streaming and recording capabilities.

vncserver-x11-c.notes: Provides remote desktop access via VNC protocol. Port depends on display number.
